[Portrait]Wiegraf[Dialog]
Milleuda...pray forgive me.

I thought to deliver swift vengeance, yet here
I am before you, my own blade sheathed beside
me as yours lies sheathed within the earth.
I have failed at much, but I shall not fail you.
Your killers will know vengeance! In this, at
least, I shall not be disgraced.{END}

[Portrait]Man's Voice[Dialog]
You speak of a thing beyond your doing.{END}

Show yourself!{END}

[Portrait]Knight[Dialog]
Put aside your sword.{END}

I've no wish to cross blades with the
leader of the Corpse Brigade, even
if the Brigade itself is no more.
...My apologies. My words salt wounds
still fresh, and that was not my intent.
Your men died valiantly.{END}

Make your purpose plain!{END}

My name is Loffrey, and I come at
another's behest.

My purpose is a simple one: to find you.
We'd hoped you might be persuaded to
work with us toward our common goal.{END}

Common goal? Ha! What jest, this?


Claiming the bounty on my head is
no goal of mine! But that is what
you seek, am I not mistaken?{END}

[Portrait]Loffrey[Dialog]
Pardon my presumption, but I do not think the
tears upon your cheek those born of laughter.{END}

...{END}

It is not coin that we desire.


It is our wish to rebuild Ivalice-to uproot
her foundations, and see that she is not
twice made slave to nobility.
And that -is- what you seek, is it not?{END}

You have my ears.{END}

Our ideals are not so very different.
A fire burns in you, as it burns in us.

Your strength, your passion-your spirit!
We would welcome these to our cause.{END}

You mean to use me.{END}

To every coin there are two faces.
Do you not consider the other?

Join us, and our power becomes yours
to wield.

Have you, alone, the strength to venge
Milleuda? Have you, alone, the power to
grasp the reins of Ivalice?{END}
